head.supplied: Melbourne, 22/6/76 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to inform you that a deputation of the Trustees of the Royal Park waited this day on the Hon. the Minister of the Lands Department, to urge the issue of ...

div.p: A345 Royal Park Zoological Society letter & minute book, p.60, Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.

I have the honor to inform you that a deputation of the Trustees of the Royal Park waited this day on the Hon. the Minister of the Lands Department, to urge the issue of the Crown-deed for the Park, with a view also to place the trustees in the position, so soon as the grant is made out, to give at once every attention to the application of your Society.
See also M to W. MacFarlane, 17 June 1876. The Victorian Agricultural Society had requested that an area of approximately 25 acres of the Royal Park should be transferred to them. When the crown deed for the Park was issued to the Trustees, this land was duly excised from the Park. However, it was never ceded to the Agricultural Society, which was instead granted land in Flemington, and was eventually sold.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be

div.p:
Secretary to the Victorian Agricultural Society.
See also M to W. H. Archer, 21 August 1876.
